issues.description: The template's example Main (template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java) shows creating Seal, Pig, and Goat using two-argument constructors (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")), but the problem statement/UML and the solution implement these animals with single-argument constructors that only take the name (e.g. Seal(String name)). This mismatch can confuse students about the expected constructor signatures and will cause compilation errors if they uncomment and run the provided Main without adjusting either the Main calls or their constructors.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the example usages in the template Main consistent with the specification and solution. Replace the two-argument constructor calls with single-argument calls that only pass the name (e.g. Seal("Clarabelle"), Pig("Doodle"), Goat("Buttinsky")). Alternatively, if the intent was to include a second attribute, update the problem statement/UML and the solution classes to include that attribute and corresponding constructor parameter. The first option (fixing Main) is preferred to match the UML and provided solution.
